Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 花屋
Entry.EnglishText: Florist

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: 花屋の女の子
Entry.EnglishText: Florist's Daughter

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: notice
Entry.EnglishText: Notice

Entry.JapaneseText: おばあさん
Entry.EnglishText: Grandma

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダ・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Razilda - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダ・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Razilda - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: なあに、お兄ちゃんたち？
Entry.EnglishText: What? You need something, mister?

Entry.JapaneseText: キミが売ってる花は、 どこで摘んで来たんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: Where do you get the flowers that are in your stand right now?

Entry.JapaneseText: ナイショ!!
Entry.EnglishText: That's a SECRET.

Entry.JapaneseText: だって、教えたら 摘みに行くんでしょ？ わたしのお花が売れなく なっちゃうもん。
Entry.EnglishText: I mean, if I tell you then you're gonna go and pick them right? Then I won't be able to sell them anymore.

Entry.JapaneseText: そう言わずに教えてくれよ。 おれは花が大好きなんだ。 ホラ、このとおり!!
Entry.EnglishText: Aw, c'mon, pretty please? I just love flowers! See, here's proof!

Entry.JapaneseText: すごーい!! こんなお花、見た事ない!!
Entry.EnglishText: Whoaaa! I've never seen a flower like this before!

Entry.JapaneseText: これはな、西の大陸にだけ 咲いてるティートレーイの花だ。 キミにあげてもいいけど……？
Entry.EnglishText: Well y'see, this is the “Tie Tri” flower that only blooms on the Western continent. I might be able to part with it, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: 教えてあげる!! だから、そのお花ちょーだい。
Entry.EnglishText: I'll tell you!! I'll tell you, just gimme that flower!

Entry.JapaneseText: おう、交渉成立だ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oho, then it's a deal!

Entry.JapaneseText: ありがとう!!
Entry.EnglishText: Thanks!!

Entry.JapaneseText: えっとね、わたしのお花はね、 ラジルダとピピスタの街の まんなかぐらいにある泉で 摘んで来るの。
Entry.EnglishText: So like, there's this spring, okay? And it's right in-between Razilda and a town called Pipista. That's where I pick them.

Entry.JapaneseText: おばあさんには、いつもいろんな お花を摘んで来てあげるの。
Entry.EnglishText: I always bring some to the old lady after I pick them.

Entry.JapaneseText: おばあさんの息子さんはね、 お外に出られないから、 お花も見られないでしょ？
Entry.EnglishText: That old lady has a son who can't go outside, so that means he can't see any flowers and stuff right?

Entry.JapaneseText: 息子さんも、おばあさんも お花を見たら元気になれるって……
Entry.EnglishText: So like, they both get really happy whenever I bring them these flowers...

Entry.JapaneseText: やさしいんだな。 これからも、おばあさんに やさしくしてやってくれよな。
Entry.EnglishText: You're a sweet girl. Keep helping out that old lady from now on, okay?

Entry.JapaneseText: うん!!
Entry.EnglishText: Okay!!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……って事だ。
Entry.EnglishText: And that's that!

Entry.JapaneseText: 行くぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Let's go!

Entry.JapaneseText: この前、泉のところで 見たことのないお花を見つけたの。
Entry.EnglishText: The other day, I found a flower at the spring that I had never seen before.

Entry.JapaneseText: 図鑑にのってなかったら 大発見かも……
Entry.EnglishText: If it's not in your book, then it'd for sure be a great discovery...

Entry.JapaneseText: ねぇねぇ、図鑑貸して♪
Entry.EnglishText: Hey hey, can I borrow your picture book?♪

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:00><scale:0140> はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:00><scale:0140>Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『図鑑』を貸し出しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You lent away your Collector's book.

Entry.JapaneseText: ありがとう。 ちゃんと見るから、 チョット待っててね♪
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you. I need some time to look at it so wait!♪

Entry.JapaneseText: 図鑑があれば 調べられるんだけどなぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: If only I had a book with pictures, I could find it!

Entry.JapaneseText: ねぇねぇ、聞いて聞いてっ！ 私が見つけたお花、 図鑑に載ってなかったの！
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, listen! That flower I found, it's not in the book!

Entry.JapaneseText: これは大発見♪ どんな名前をつけようかなぁ。 ……あっ。コレ、ありがと。
Entry.EnglishText: This is a great Discovery!♪ I wonder what name I should give it. ....Oh right, here you go! And thanks!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『図鑑』を回収しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You got back your Collector's book.

Entry.JapaneseText: どんな名前がいいかなぁー。
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder what kind of name it should have...

Entry.JapaneseText: うーん。これじゃない。 これも似てるけど違う……
Entry.EnglishText: Hmm... Not this one. This one is similar but also different...

Entry.JapaneseText: あっ、ごめんね。 もうチョット貸しといて！
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, sorry. I need some more time!

Entry.JapaneseText: 泉のところで見つけたから イズミノハナ……うーん。 もっとカワイイのが良いな……
Entry.EnglishText: Because I found it at the Spring, I'll name it the Spring Flower... I'd prefer something cuter though...

Entry.JapaneseText: 兵隊さんが来て、 お外に出ちゃいけないって……
Entry.EnglishText: The soldiers came and ordered us not to go outside...

Entry.JapaneseText: でも人も、花と同じで お外で太陽に当たらなきゃ いけないんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: But people, like flowers, need to be outside and enjoy the sun.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてみんな種族の事で ケンカするのかな……？
Entry.EnglishText: Why do we have so much interspecies fighting...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 私やおばあさんみたいに ヒューマとガジュマでも なかよくできるのに……
Entry.EnglishText: I think Huma and Gajuma can get along just like me and my grandmother.

Entry.JapaneseText: 秘薬ですか？ 知ってますよ。 貴重な薬ですからね。
Entry.EnglishText: The secret potion? Oh, I know what it is. It's a precious medicine.

Entry.JapaneseText: よそから来た人には なかなか手に 入らないかもしれませんね。
Entry.EnglishText: It may be difficult for people from other parts of the world to get it.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ラジルダの旗ですか…… 以前はウチにもあったのですが、 フォグマ様の遣いの方がいらして、 持って行かれました。
Entry.EnglishText: The Razildan Flag? I used to have one myself, but a messenger of Chief Fogma's came and took it away.

Entry.JapaneseText: やはり無いか……
Entry.EnglishText: So there really aren't any left...

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダの旗が どうかされたのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: May I ask why you are in such a need of this flag?

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダの旗に描かれてる <Cyan>紋章<White>について調べてるんだけど、 肝心の旗が見つからなくて……
Entry.EnglishText: We need an actual Razildan Flag in order to do some investigation into the <Cyan>Crest<White> printed on it, but we can't find one anywhere.

Entry.JapaneseText: そういう事ですか…… <Cyan>紋章<White>にまつわる昔話のような ものでもよろしければ、 お話させていただきますが……
Entry.EnglishText: Is that so? If you would like, I can tell you an old story related to the flag's <Cyan>Crest<White>...

Entry.JapaneseText: ぜひ、聞かせてください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please, by all means.

Entry.JapaneseText: では、お話しましょう。 古くからの言い伝えでは、 あの<Cyan>紋章<White>は<Blue>闇の力<White>を 意味しているそうです……
Entry.EnglishText: Then listen well. According to oral teachings passed down through history, the <Cyan>Crest<White> of the Razildan flag symbolizes the <Blue>Dark Power<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Blue>闇の力<White>？
Entry.EnglishText: <Blue>Dark Power<White>?

Entry.JapaneseText: 大昔……この辺りには どんな願いもかなえられる <Blue>闇の力<White>というものが あったそうです。
Entry.EnglishText: It is said... That long, long ago, there existed in this region a <Blue>Dark Power<White> that could grant any kind of wish.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマは忌むべきものと恐れ、 ヒューマは聖なるものとして崇め、 考えの違いをめぐって、争いが 絶える事はありませんでした……
Entry.EnglishText: Feared by Gajuma as something to be shunned, yet revered by Huma as a sacred object, these contrasting ideas gave rise to a conflict that seemed impossible to suppress.

Entry.JapaneseText: やがて、人々は<Blue>闇の力<White>が 争いのもとだと気づきました。 ふたつの種族は力を合わせ、 <Blue>闇の力<White>をどこかの泉に沈めたのです。
Entry.EnglishText: Eventually, people came to the realization that the <Blue>Dark Power<White> brought only strife. The two races combined their strength and submerged the <Blue>Dark Power<White> in a spring somewhere.
A spring...

Entry.JapaneseText: 争いの愚を戒め、ふたつの種族が 手を取り合う事を願って、 <Blue>闇の力<White>を表すその印を、街の旗の 真ん中に据えたそうです。
Entry.EnglishText: As a warning against future conflict and as a hope that both races could walk hand in hand, the <Blue>Dark Power<White> was displayed as a seal on the town's flag.

Entry.JapaneseText: 「時を越え、我らは共に歌う。 そこに道は開かれん」って、 ふたつの種族が協力してラジルダを 作った、ってコトを言ってるんだネ？
Entry.EnglishText: "Across time, our voices harmonize. Therein, the path unties." That must be referring to the unity of Huma and Gajuma, who worked together to create Razilda.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私はそういう事だと 思っています……
Entry.EnglishText: I do believe that is so.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Blue>闇の力<White>を沈めた泉は どこにあるの？
Entry.EnglishText: Where is the spring which contains this <Blue>Dark Power<White>?

Entry.JapaneseText: わかりません…… 本当にあったとしても、 <Blue>闇の力<White>にふれるべきなのか どうか……
Entry.EnglishText: I do not know. And assuming it truly exists, I am not sure the <Blue>Dark Power<White> is something to be tampered with...

Entry.JapaneseText: 花と言えば、花屋の娘さんは よく色んな花を持ってきてくれますよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Speaking of flowers, the florist's daughter often brings me a variety of flowers.

Entry.JapaneseText: どこで摘んでくるのか、 本当に色んな花をね。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't know what I'm going to do with all these different flowers.

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、ますますガジュマと ヒューマの関係が悪化していて……
Entry.EnglishText: Recently, the relationship between Gajuma and Huma has been getting worse and worse...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうすればいいんでしょう…… 私の力でどうにかなる事でも ありませんけど……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't know what to do.... It's not something I can help change either....

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだか、とても 外が騒がしくて…… どうしたんでしょう？
Entry.EnglishText: It was kind of noisy out there... I wonder what's going on?

Entry.JapaneseText: 大変な事に なりました……
Entry.EnglishText: I can't believe such a thing happened...

Entry.JapaneseText: こんな時に、あの子の具合が 悪くならなければいいのだけれど……
Entry.EnglishText: I hope she doesn't get sick at a time like this...

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの子は病弱で…… いつも寝たきりなんです。
Entry.EnglishText: My child is sickly and weak... He's always bedridden.

Entry.JapaneseText: たまに元気な事があっても 外に出る事ができなくって……
Entry.EnglishText: Sometimes I feel fine, but I'm not allowed to go outside.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:00><scale:0140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:00><scale:0140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:00>『ホットミルク』 砂糖がたくさん入った、 甘くて温かいミルク。 表面に薄い膜が張っている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:00>[Hot Milk] Sweet, warm milk with lots of sugar. It has a thin film on the surface.

Entry.JapaneseText: ボク、このペラペラしたの キラーイ！
Entry.EnglishText: I hate these flimsy things!

Entry.JapaneseText: この膜、大してウマくもないのに、 ついつい食べちゃうんだよなぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: The film is not very good, but I can't stop eating it.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:00>『ラジルダチェス』 通常のチェスとは少し違う ラジルダ特有のチェス。 通常のものより駒とマス目が少ない。 ルールも簡易化されたものなので、 子供向き。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:00>[Razilda Chess] A chess game unique to Razilda that is a little different from regular chess. It has fewer pieces and squares than the normal one. The rules are simplified, so it is suitable for children.
